item.title: How reality crushed Ÿnsect, the French startup that had raised over $600M for insect farming
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: French insect farming company Ÿnsect was recently placed into judicial liquidation for insolvency, despite raising over $600 million.

item.title: Equity’s 2026 Predictions: AI Agents, Blockbuster IPOs, and the Future of VC
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Rebecca Bellan, Anthony Ha, Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: TechCrunch’s Equity crew is bringing 2025 to a close and getting ahead on the year to come with our annual predictions episode! Hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan were joined by Build Mode host Isabelle Johannessen to dissect the year’s biggest tech developments, from mega AI funding rounds that defied expectations to the rise of “physical AI,” and make […]

item.title: Naware’s chemical-free weed killer tech could change how we treat lawns
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: A classic hardware startup, Naware set out with a problem -- kill weeds without chemicals -- and relentlessly tinkered until they found a solution.

item.title: The 9 top cybersecurity startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Here is the full list of the cybersecurity Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: How a Spanish virus brought Google to Málaga
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Spanish entrepreneur Bernardo Quintero, whose company is at the root of Google's Málaga cybersecurity hub, identified the author of the computer virus that influenced his career.

item.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.

item.title: Why the operating room is ripe for AI, according to Akara
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between, from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to […]

item.title: The 9 top biotech startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Here is the full list of the biotech and pharma Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: How Mill closed the deal with Amazon and Whole Foods
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Matt Rogers' food waste startup will soon deploy its commercial food waste bins in grocery stores throughout the U.S. Here's how Rogers thinks about preparing a startup for success.

item.title: The 14 top agtech, food tech startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Here is the full list of the agtech and food tech Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: Can AI fix the operating room? This startup thinks so
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to guesswork about room […]

item.title: Marissa Mayer’s new startup Dazzle raises $8M led by Forerunner’s Kirsten Green
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Mayer launched Dazzle after shuttering her photo and contact management startup Sunshine. Green’s investment suggests Dazzle is poised for the coming wave of new AI-infused consumer businesses.

item.title: The tooth fairy just got reimagined for the tech-savvy generation
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Tooth Fairy Tracker features Kiki the Tooth Fairy as its central character. When a child loses a tooth, parents can visit the website and enter their email to receive notifications as Kiki begins her mission.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Kate Park, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2025.

item.title: As EU waters down 2035 EV goals, electric startups express concern
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Instead of requiring 100% of new cars to be zero-emission vehicles by that date, the revised plan would allow 10% of new car sales to be hybrids or other vehicles as long as manufacturers purchase carbon offsets to compensate.

item.title: OpenAI allows users to directly adjust ChatGPT’s enthusiasm level
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The tweaks allow users to further customize ChatGPT’s tone, on top of the existing ability to set a “base style and tone” — including the Professional, Candid, and Quirky tones that OpenAI added in November.

item.title: Building venture-backable companies in heavily regulated spaces
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: This week on Build Mode, Startup Battlefield editor Isabelle Johannessen spoke to two founders who are working to make progress in industries ripe for disruption, despite the regulatory headaches that might have deterred many other people.

item.title: Where are investors placing their bets next year? AI, AI, AI.
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Investors at TechCrunch Disrupt explained their focus on artificial intelligence and offered advice to founders on how to stand out in a crowded AI field.

item.title: Cursor continues acquisition spree with Graphite deal
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Graphite is an AI code review assistant that was last valued at $290 million.

item.title: Yann LeCun confirms his new ‘world model’ startup, reportedly seeks $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Renowned AI scientist Yann LeCun confirmed on Thursday the worst-kept secret in the tech world: that he had indeed launched a new startup. Although he did say he will not be running the new company as its CEO.
